tachyon.hadoop

Class TFS

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configured
      • org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
        • tachyon.hadoop.TFS
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    Closeable, AutoCloseable, org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configurable

    @PublicApi
public final class TFS
extends org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
    A Tachyon client API compatible with Apache Hadoop FileSystem interface. Any program working with Hadoop HDFS can work with Tachyon transparently. Note that the performance of using this TFS API may not be as efficient as the performance of using the Tachyon native API defined in FileSystem, which TFS is built on top of.

    • Method Detail

      • getScheme

        public String getScheme()
        Gets the URI schema that maps to the FileSystem. This was introduced in Hadoop 2.x as a means to make loading new FileSystem s simpler. This doesn't exist in Hadoop 1.x, so cannot put @Override.
        Returns:
        schema hadoop should map to
        See Also:
        FileSystem.createFileSystem(java.net.URI, org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration)

      • isZookeeperMode

        protected boolean isZookeeperMode()
        Determines if zookeeper should be used for the FileSystem. This method should only be used for initialize(java.net.URI, org.apache.hadoop.conf.Configuration).
        Returns:
        true if zookeeper should be used

      • create

        public org.apache.hadoop.fs.FSDataOutputStream create(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path cPath,
                                                      org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.FsPermission permission,
                                                      boolean overwrite,
                                                      int bufferSize,
                                                      short replication,
                                                      long blockSize,
                                                      org.apache.hadoop.util.Progressable progress)
                                               throws IOException
        Attempts to create a file. Overwrite will not succeed if the path exists and is a folder.
        Specified by:
        create in class org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
        Parameters:
        cPath - path to create
        permission - permissions of the created file/folder
        overwrite - overwrite if file exists
        bufferSize - the size in bytes of the buffer to be used
        replication - under filesystem replication factor
        blockSize - block size in bytes
        progress - queryable progress
        Returns:
        an FSDataOutputStream created at the indicated path of a file
        Throws:
        IOException - if overwrite is not specified and the path already exists or if the path is a folder

      • createNonRecursive

        @Deprecated
public org.apache.hadoop.fs.FSDataOutputStream createNonRecursive(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path cPath,
                                                                              org.apache.hadoop.fs.permission.FsPermission permission,
                                                                              boolean overwrite,
                                                                              int bufferSize,
                                                                              short replication,
                                                                              long blockSize,
                                                                              org.apache.hadoop.util.Progressable progress)
                                                                       throws IOException
        Deprecated. API only for 0.20-append
        Opens an FSDataOutputStream at the indicated Path with write-progress reporting. Same as FileSystem.create(Path, boolean, int, short, long, Progressable), except fails if parent directory doesn't already exist. TODO(hy): We need to refactor this method after having a new internal API support (TACHYON-46).
        Overrides:
        createNonRecursive in class org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
        Parameters:
        cPath - the file name to open
        overwrite - if a file with this name already exists, then if true, the file will be overwritten, and if false an error will be thrown.
        bufferSize - the size of the buffer to be used
        replication - required block replication for the file
        blockSize - the size in bytes of the buffer to be used
        progress - queryable progress
        Throws:
        IOException - if 1) overwrite is not specified and the path already exists, 2) if the path is a folder, or 3) the parent directory does not exist
        See Also:
        #setPermission(Path, FsPermission)}

        Specified by:
        delete in class org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
        Parameters:
        cPath - path to delete
        recursive - if true, will attempt to delete all children of the path
        Returns:
        true if one or more files/directories were deleted; false otherwise
        Throws:
        IOException - if the path failed to be deleted due to some constraint (ie. non empty directory with recursive flag disabled)

      • setOwner

        public void setOwner(org.apache.hadoop.fs.Path path,
                     String username,
                     String groupname)
              throws IOException
        Changes owner or group of a path (i.e. a file or a directory). If username is null, the original username remains unchanged. Same as groupname. If username and groupname are non-null, both of them will be changed.
        Overrides:
        setOwner in class org.apache.hadoop.fs.FileSystem
        Parameters:
        path - path to set owner or group
        username - username to be set
        groupname - groupname to be set
        Throws:
        IOException - if changing owner or group of the path failed
